data.title: Movies Filmed in Coober Pedy
data.meta_description: Fire in the Stone Released 1984 Starring Alan Cassell, Paul Smith & Ray Meagher From a book by Colin Thiele, by the SA Film Company.  When his precious cache of opals is stolen, 14 year-old Ernie,...
data.text:
Fire in the Stone

Released 1984

Starring Alan Cassell, Paul Smith & Ray Meagher

From a book by Colin Thiele, by the SA Film Company. When his precious cache of opals is stolen, 14 year-old Ernie, who lives in the opal fields of Australia, sets out with a friend determined to find the thief.

Where the Green Ants Dream

Released 1984 - By the German Director Werner Herzog

Set in the Australian desert, it tells the story of a feud between a mining company and the native Indigenous people.

Ground Zero

Released 1984

Starring Colin Friels, Jack Thompson and Burnum Burnum

An Australian drama/thriller about a cinematographer who, prompted by curiosity about some old film footage taken by his father, embarks on a quest to find out the truth about British nuclear tests at Maralinga, code name 'X200'.

Mad Max Beyond Thunderdome

Released 1985

Starring Mel Gibson, Tina Turner & Bruce Spence

Mad Max becomes a pawn in a decadent oasis of technological society, and when exiled, becomes the deliverer of a colony of children

Stark

Released 1993 TV Mini Film. Book by Ben Elton

Starring Colin Friels, Ben Elton & Jacqueline McKenzie

Australian Billionaire, Sly Morgan is invited to join the Stark Conspiracy, a group of the world's richest people who plan to save themselves from the Earth's impending environmental doom

Until the End of the World

Released 1991

Starring William Hurt, Solveig Dommartin & Pietro Falcone

Set in 1999, a woman has a car accident with some bank robbers, who befriend and enlist her help to take the money to a drop in Paris. On the way she runs into another fugitive from the law. On the run from the bank robbers and the CIA, they span the globe, ending up in Australia.

Priscilla Queen of the Desert

Released 1994

Starring Terence Stamp, Hugo Weaving and Guy Pearce

Two drag queens and a transexual contract to perform a drag show at a resort in Alice Springs. They head west from Sydney aboard their lavender bus 'Priscilla'

Siam Sunset

Released 1999

Starring Linus Roache, Danielle Cormack & Ian Bliss

A British design executive, who seemingly has everything going for him, has his life totally changed when a refrigerator falls from an aircraft and lands on his wife. He decides to getaway from it all by taking a trip to Australia.

Kangaroo Jack

Released 2003

Starring Jerry O'Connell, Anthony Anderson & Estella Warren

Two childhood friends, a New York hairstylist and a would-be musician, get caught up with the mob and are forced to deliver $50,000 to Australia. Things go haywire when the money is lost to a wild kangaroo.
